definition: to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to

sentences.english: The usher insisted on reseating us.
sentences.chinese: 這名招待員堅持給我們領位。

sentences.english: An usher stood at the door giving out programs.
sentences.chinese: 招待員站在門口發表節目表。

sentences.english: The usher stood at the door giving out programs.
sentences.chinese: 招待員站在門口分發節目單。

sentences.english: A bar/restaurant I know of only hires bartenders from within.
sentences.chinese: 我知道的一家酒吧，就只從內部聘用招待員。

sentences.english: Silver Sister was helped by some eye-candy usher to backstage.
sentences.chinese: 銀姐被帥哥招待員扶到後臺。

sentences.english: Seeking Full-Time Wait Staff to Work in Diplomat's Residence.
sentences.chinese: 聘請全職外交官官邸招待員。

sentences.english: We enlisted them to serve as ushers at the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 我們徵集他們當會議招待員。
